interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Brooklyn (us)
Review Date: 2016/08/21
Store: Domhnall Gleeson  (Actor),     Emory Cohen  (Actor),     John Crowley  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
Product Description: ['In the 1950s, with job prospects bleak in her native Ireland, young Eilis (Saorise Ronan) is packed off by her folks across the ocean for a clerking opportunity in New York. She tentatively comes to deal with her homesickness, a new land, and the kind attentions of Italian-American plumber Tony (Emory Cohen)-but when a family tragedy requires Eilis to return home, she’s faced with wrenching choices between her old life and the one she has built. Evocative coming-of-age tale also stars Domhnall Gleeson, Julie Walters, Jim Broadbent; Nick Hornby adapted the Colm Tóibín novel for the screen. 111 min.']
Average Rating: 4.7

Bridge of Spies DVD
Tom Hanks  (Actor),     Mark Rylance  (Actor),     Steven Spielberg  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Mystery & Thrillers
['A dramatic thriller set against the backdrop of a series of historic events, BRIDGE OF SPIES is "absolutely brilliant and totally riveting" (Bill Zwecker, Chicago Sun-Times). James Donovan (Tom Hanks) is a Brooklyn lawyer who finds himself thrust into the center of the Cold War when the CIA send him on a nearly impossible mission to negotiate the release of a captured American U-2 pilot. High stakes and suspense power a story that captures the essence of a man who risked everything, vividly bringing his personal journey to life.']

Spotlight [DVD]
Mark Ruffalo  (Actor),     Michael Keaton  (Actor),     Tom McCarthy  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Universal Studios Featured Deals
['Michael Keaton, Mark Ruffalo, and Rachel McAdams lead a critically acclaimed cast in this gripping true story about the Pulitzer Prize-winning investigation that uncovered a scandal that rocked one of the world\'s oldest and most trusted institutions. Delving into allegations of child abuse within the local Catholic Archdiocese, a tenacious team of Boston Globe reporters exposes a decades-long cover-up that reaches the highest levels of Boston\'s religious, legal, and government establishment. "Brilliantly acted and flawlessly directed" (New York Post) Spotlight is a powerful and riveting drama the critics are calling "the All the President\'s Men of our time" (Los Angeles Times).', 'Bonus Content:', 'Uncovering the Truth: A Spotlight Team Roundtable', 'Uncovering the Truth: A Spotlight Team Roundtable', 'Spotlight: A Look Inside', 'Spotlight: A Look Inside', 'The State of Journalism', 'The State of Journalism', ']]>']

['Creed (2-Disc/DVD)', 'Adonis Johnson (Michael B. Jordan), son of Adonis Johnson (Michael B. Jordan), le fils du défunt champion du monde des poids lourds Apollo Creed, a la boxe dans le sang. En quête d’un titre bien à lui, Adonis se rend à Philadelphie et convainc Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone), ancien rival puis grand ami de son père, de devenir son entraîneur, même si Rocky livre lui aussi un combat contre un ennemi mortel hors du ring. Adonis a désormais une bonne chance, mais il doit d’abord développer l’âme d’un vrai pugiliste dans ce nouveau chapitre de la saga Rocky du réalisateur acclamé Ryan Coogler deceased world heavyweight champion Apollo Creed, has boxing in his blood. Looking to win his own title, Adonis heads to Philadelphia and convinces his father’s rival-turned-friend, Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone), to train him – even as Rocky battles his own deadly opponent outsidethe ring. fighter in this new chapter of the Rocky story from critically acclaimed director Ryan Coogler.', ']]>']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preference:** User continues to prioritize comedy films while expanding their interest in complex dramas with significant social themes. They have shown a particular appreciation for coming-of-age narratives and emotionally impactful stories, especially those set against a backdrop of migration and personal growth.

- **Entertainment Consumption:** The user remains enthusiastic about productions featuring well-known actors and directors, maintaining admiration for figures like Tom Hanks and new actors such as Domhnall Gleeson. They are increasingly attracted to narratives that explore real-life experiences and cultural transitions.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user's ratings reflect a strong inclination towards uplifting and resonant narratives. They have embraced varied storytelling approaches, particularly in dramas that highlight themes of resilience and overcoming adversity, as evidenced by their recent preferred rating for a poignant film.

- **Social Themes:** Their commitment to tales surrounding personal and societal challenges persists, with a focus on stories that emphasize companionship and the journey of personal growth.

- **Format and Accessibility:** As before, the user prefers DVD formats with subtitle options, ensuring a comprehensive and accessible viewing experience.

- **Review Style:** Their reviews remain concise yet impactful, capturing the emotional depth and essence of storytelling, especially in relation to significant cultural and social issues.

Overall, the user illustrates a balanced taste for films that blend humor with profound narratives, reflecting an evolving interest in diverse emotional experiences and impactful storytelling.
